Lippman, Josée Lajoie, Barbara E. Moo Accelerated C++. Andrew Koenig Slides: The Spirit of C++ Back To Basics: Modern C++ Style File I/O Read text file one line at a time #include <fstream> std::ifstream in_file('file.

item.title: Emacs
item.description: Basic configuration General commands Kill ring Calculator Console-size split screen MELPA package repository Solarized theme For R Emacs Speaks Statistics Auto-complete Smart underscores Poly-mode for R + Markdown Custom keyboard shortcuts For writing Spell checking Thesaurus and synonyms Grammar checking For LaTeX Word count Chunk folding For Markdown Table formatting Markdown live preview For Python Elpy python mode Send commands to a specific buffer For C/CPP Tags For Shell For WDL workflows For file manipulation Compare two files (diff) CSV/TSV Dired mode For Version Control File encryption On HPCs For online notes Evernote Simplenote For OSX Maximize window at opening Keybindings Ispell Explicit path definition I use Emacs for almost everything: coding, writing, taking notes, managing tasks, using version control, preparing presentations.

item.title: Expression
item.description: Writing General Starting the sentence Explanation Not sure Opening Nice expression/style Introduce the second part of a sentence Introduction/reviews Intro the intro Pionner work Changing subject More Closing Discussion Oral Expression Advices Writing Some recommendations from Sportscience: i.e. and e.g. only within parenthesis (is that a thing?) aim for economy. However or synonyms at most once per paragraph. while/since for time related stuff, not instead of whereas/although/because.

item.title: LaTeX
item.description: Cheatsheets Standard packages TinyTeX Misc Document class Page size Font sizes Change the symbol in lists Math calligraphy Languages and encoding Links Table of contents Metadata Figures Position Sub-figures Supplementary figures Tables Control tabular width Add vertical padding Supplementary tables Spanning columns/rows Align columns Rectangular selection/cut/paste Tables from R Code blocks For manuscripts Abstract Author affiliation Text formatting Notes/comments Main text and supplements in two documents Compare versions and highlight revisions One figure = one file Bibliography Reduce long list of authors “Name Year” style Order of initials No URL or DOI Presentations Changing the font Section slides Themes Background image Backup slides Link to frame A lot of good information in the LaTeX Wikibook.

item.title: Markdown
item.description: Tips Converting Markdown into nice HTML pages Converting Markdown into slides Jekyll websites Themes Table of Contents Math formulas blogdown websites Themes Table of Contents Draft posts Math formulas Bibliography R Markdown Tips / to add some vertical space/break (e.g. in slides). Use two ` and a space to escape ` in inline code. E.g `` `pwd` `` gives `pwd`. --- to add horizontal line/separation.

item.title: Math/Stats
item.description: Probability distributions Binomial Hypergeometric Normal Poisson Beta-binomial Beta Statistical tests Student t-test Fisher’s exact test \(\chi^2\) test Wilcoxon test ANOVA Regression & Machine Learning Linear regression LASSO LOESS Machine Learning basics CART Neural Networks SVM Misc stats Markov Model Monte Carlo methods MCMC Hidden Markov Model Maximum Likelihood Estimation Expectation-Maximization Greedy algorithm Bayesian vs Frequentist FM-index Graph theory De Bruijn graphs Hamiltonian path Euclidian path Algebra SVD decomposition PCA All of this is mostly extracted from Wikipedia.

item.title: Org mode
item.description: Org file Configuration Syntax Keybindings From anywhere Edit mode Timestamps Repeating events Agenda views Capture TODO entry Tables Code block Property drawer Habits entry Links Tags Clocking time Custom agenda views To check next I’m giving Org mode a try. This page will contain my configuration and the small subset of commands that I want to learn. Org Manual Org Mode - Organize Your Life In Plain Text!

item.title: Python
item.description: Naming and formatting Objects Array Hash Class String Function Input/Output Module, files, imports Packaging code Install a module locally Passing arguments to a script Graphs Shell integration Timing Bioinfo Sequences Fasta SAM files VCF Tricks Jupyter notebooks Some notes on my recent attempt to learn Python. Naming and formatting Use lowercase _-separated for modules and functions name. E.g. my_function. Use CapsWord for classes.

item.title: R
item.description: Details to remember Order in condition assessment Read files in chunk Graphs Palette with many colors ggplot2 tricks Multi-panel ggplots Change font in ggplot2 Waffle graphs Rmarkdown Zoom-on-click images Beamer presentation Jekyll website data.table package Rcpp Linux setup What They Forgot to Teach You About R Details to remember Use rbindlist from data.table package for a memory-optimized and faster do.call(rbind, list(.

item.title: Shell
item.description: External links GNU screen .bashrc aliases Misc Colors in less Avoid killing ssh jobs Custom prompt One-liners Bash & Pipes AWK Perl one-liners Shell scripting Variables Looping If Then Else Modules Ubuntu Sound problems OSX Mount server Setup WD Elements external hard drive This page focuses on configuration of the terminal, one-liners and scripting. Command-line tools I used (e.g. git, snakemake, docker) are described in the Tools page.

item.title: Tools
item.description: Git Snakemake jq vd rsync Docker WDL Makefile FTP For file conversion Misc PDF Git Commit all modification and added files: git commit -am "informative message" To show all the history of a file: git log -p -- file To retrieve a specific version of a file: git show COMMIT:file Revert repo to a specific commit: git checkout COMMIT Undo a commit: git reset HEAD~ and then for the real commit git commit -c ORIG_HEAD.

item.title: Internet
item.description: Misc tools DuckDuckGo Ubuntu Sync a specific Google Drive folder on Ubuntu Sync PDFs between Mendeley and Google Drive Zotero Dowload files from Dropbox Record a webradio stream with VLC Misc tools https://www.diagrams.net/ to make cartoon and diagrams (used to be draw.io) MS Paint Online DuckDuckGo DuckDuckGo is a “search engine that doesn’t track you”. It provides nice “bangs” to search directly specific websites.

item.title: About
item.description: About this website This is where I put all the useful information I keep on forgetting. Instead of googling the same things over and over, wasting time and server energy I put them here. It’s like a second memory, better than my hippocampus, my hippocamPLUS… About me Personal page with links. Twitter. My current lab Computational Genomics Lab at UCSC. Genomics Institute at UCSC My previous labs Bourque Lab.
